intro: Blepharodon hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy blepharodon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a distinctive texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens. It is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
